AAAARRRRGGGGHHHH!!!!

To do sound/pictures there's two ways to do it:
1) Execute the file... Execute is in QDK somewhere.
2) open the picture/sound file using Quest... As far as I know only .bmp's and .gifs for pictures with .mod and .midi for sounds are available (Alex - why aren't you using media player to open .mp3's and .wavs and stuff? Would also save me converting any movie's to moving .gif's).

The first is ALWAYS the best - the player can usually play/watch the file you're trying to open.
The second is mainly for convenience - stopping windows opening up all over the players' screen.

In both cases you should put the file inside the same directory as THE GAME (not the darn quest directory) and then execute or open the FILE NAME ONLY!!!! So if you have the file "d:\whatever\pic.gif" you put "pic.gif" and have your game file in "d:\whatever\".
